data.text: @fantoman79 Non medical doctors who tweet relentlessly about covid whilst retaining the title of Dr in their handle really are the worst kind of charlatans.

@fantoman79 The simplest Google search would reveal to him that it's got nothing to do with "total pop vax rate < 80%" and everything to do with horrifically low vax rates amongst the elderly.

And HKers wear masks everywhere outside their homes.
@maks_amillion I think Henrys madness predates Shanes.
@fantoman79 This comment a year ago would be appropriate.  Now itâ€™s just embarrassing.
@fantoman79 Its like Shane Huntingdon handed the baton to Henry
@fantoman79 This guy is truly brain damaged... He used to be bad, now he's truly terrible.

@fantoman79 @InvertedGuy17 That is true as the effect of boosters on reducing transmission is significantly better than 2 doses. Focussed efforts on elderly and vulnerable will really reduce hospitalisation which I think is what we are seeing in NZ and likely WA.

@gasman_al @InvertedGuy17 I think it's fair that boosting the young helps reduce the overall case load of breakthrough infections which can provide *some* additional protection to the elderly and vulnerable but should be done in conjunction with a more focussed effort to boost the higher risk groups.
@AndrewHayen @fantoman79 I like it when he acknowledges if you actually look at the data you see the likely cause. 🤣
@gasman_al @fantoman79 Is there a platform with attribute search? Countries with over 50% overall AND over 90% in aged groups?
